newsitem.title: USA: Hormel says union ratifies contract.
newsitem.headline: Hormel says union ratifies contract.

text.p: Hormel Foods Corp officials early Monday said meatcutters at its Rochelle, Ill. pork plant had ratified a new 4-year contract.

Members of United Food and Commercial Workers Union Local 1540 had voted Sunday to ratify the latest contract following negotiations that resulted when workers' latest contract expired on February 23.
Union members had threatened to strike on Monday if the final offer had not been ratified on Sunday.
Rochelle Foods, a wholly owned subsidiary of Hormel, employs 1,150 of which 900 are union members, said Mitch Montgomery, head of UFCW Local 1540.
The hog slaughter and processing plant has a daily slaughter capacity of about 7,000 head, market sources said.
